member.name: T:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType
member.summary: An enum representing what kind of commands could be handled by the server and the client. Its header is composed in this way [ [HeaderIdentifier {byte:4}][MessageLength {byte:4}][ MessageId {byte:4} ][ Command {byte:1} ] ] so at least you have 13 unmovable positioned bytes. Its finel header is composed in this way [ [EndHeader {byte:4}] ] Do not modify these values unless you really are pretty sure about what you are doing. Also each command has a priority level, the lowest the level number the highest priority. 0 - Critical priority -> Connection commands. 1 - High priority -> User commands. These commands are passed to the upside level. 2 - At this moment this level has no commands. 3 - Chat commands, the lowest priority on the system.

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.Null
member.summary: These commands belongs to the 0 level of priority.

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.Unknown
member.summary: Void message, so if you are receiving this kind of messages means that something is wrong.

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.StopServer
member.summary: Its purpose is to tell the server to shutdown itself.

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.RestartServer
member.summary: Restarts the server.It is not implemeneted.

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.Handshake
member.summary: Handshake command used to begin a connection between the server and the client. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.NewClient
member.summary: NewClient command used by the client to try to stablish a connection with the server. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.RefuseConnection
member.summary: Means that the server just droped the connection.

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.ServerFull
member.summary: Message sent when the server is full and a new client is attempting to connect to the game. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.Authentication
member.summary: Command used by the client to send its authentication information. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ UsernameLenght {byte:1}] [ Username {byte:1-} ][HashLength{2}][ HashedUsernameAndPassword {byte:1-} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.AuthenticationFail
member.summary: Command to tells that something went wrong while the authentication process. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.AuthenticationSuccess
member.summary: Command to tells that the access is granted. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.UDPSettingUp
member.summary: Command sent by the server to tell the remote client wich port has been assigned to it also sends the pairing code. Either it works to test the connection. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ PortNumber{byte:4}][ PairingCode {byte:4} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.UDPPairing
member.summary: Command send by the remote client to test the UDP connection, and the client establishes the message structure. *It is sent through the UDP socket.* [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ PairingNumber{byte:4} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.UDPPairingOk
member.summary: Command sent by the server to tell the remote client that everything is ok. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.UDPPairingFail
member.summary: Command sent by the server to tell the remote client that its message has been received but its pairing code was wrong, anyway the connection works. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.ChatSettingUp
member.summary: Tells the remote client how many chat groups are registered inside the server. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ ChatGroupsCount { byte:2 } ] ( [ChatGroupId {byte:2} ] [ ChatGroupNameLength{byte:}][ ChatGroupName{byte:1-}] ) ... [ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.KeepAlive
member.summary: Resets the TCP timer and avoids the TimedOut socket error.TCP timeout exception ocurs after 8 hours of inactivity. [MessageHeader{ byte:4}][Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnect command to a nicely way to say goodbye. [Header {byte:4}][ Command {byte:1} ][ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.User
member.summary: Command used to mark the message and bypass it to the app. This is the empty message. [MessageHeader {byte:13}][UserCommand {byte:1}][Targets {byte:4}]......Whatever you need........[ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.Chat
member.summary: Chat command. [MessageHeader {byte:13}][ From ( [ HashLength{ byte:2 } ][HashedId {byte:1-} ] ) ] [ GroupId{byte:2}] [MessageLength{byte:2}][ MessageBody{byte1:-}] [ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]

member.name: F:KSPM.Network.Common.Messages.Message.CommandType.UDPChat
member.summary: UDP Chat command. A chat message sent through the UDP connection. [MessageHeader {byte:13}][ From ( [ HashLength{ byte:2 } ][HashedId {byte:1-} ] ) ] [ GroupId{byte:2}] [MessageLength{byte:2}][ MessageBody{byte1:-}] [ EndOfMessage {byte:4} ]
